subject: Sleep
title: Sleep and False Memories
description: One-minute skill: Sleep and False Memories.

hook.text: After a night of sleep, people sometimes remember things that never happened. Sleep can create false memories.

buildup.text: During consolidation, the brain doesn't just copy memories. It reconstructs and reinterprets them.

discovery.text: Sleep extracts the gist of experiences, which sometimes fills in gaps with plausible but invented details.

twist.text: Studies show sleep increases confidence in false memories. You feel more certain about things that never happened.

climax.text: This is useful for pattern extraction but dangerous for eyewitness testimony after a night's sleep.

punchline.text: Sleep makes memories feel truer, even the fake ones.

quiz.question: How can sleep affect false memories?
options: It can increase confidence in memories that never happened
It has no effect on memory accuracy
